routes.name: Sugar mills of Santa Cruz
routes.shortDescription: Steep but varied walk from the town centre passing historic sugar mills.
routes.description: A short but steep circuit passing out of town past attractive houses with views along the way, then descending past the historic water mills and back down into town.
routes.routeFile: LP01 Sugar mills of Santa Cruz
routes.refreshments: Bar/Restaurants along LP-101 and at Las Nieves.

images.caption: Sugar mills near Santa Cruz
Iglesia de El Salvador, Plaza de España
Steep climb past colourful houses

variants.name: Santa Cruz highlights
variants.description: A fairly long and strenuous circuit taking in the best bits around Santa Cruz including a great viewpoint, a canal path through semi rural areas, the church at Las Nieves, a dry riverbed descent, and watermills.

notes: Minor risk along safe fenced bit of path after the mills.

routes.name: Mirador and waterways
routes.shortDescription: Varied walk to a viewpoint, along a covered canal and down a dry riverbed.
routes.description: A varied walk taking in a spectacular viewpoint over Santa Cruz, a slightly adventurous walk along a water channel, a church with an important relic and a dried river bed full of big boulders. The walk ends at the ship museum.
routes.refreshments: Bars and restaurants at the start and end points and on the way at Velhoco and Las Nieves.

images.caption: View over Santa Cruz from Mirador de la Concepción
Canal de Breña, covered waterway
Barranco de las Nieves (dried river bed)
Castillo de La Virgen, at the walk finish
Museo Naval (ship museum), at the walk finish

routes.name: Woods and springs
routes.shortDescription: Chestnut and pine forest walk with small shrines around the many springs.
routes.description: A pleasant forest walk with interest along the way from the many springs (most dry) and their sometimes fanciful and ornate decorative shrines.
routes.refreshments: Bars and restaurants in San Pedro de Breña Alta.

images.caption: One of the small shrines along the Camino de las Fuentes
Ancient washing basins near the walk start
Chestnut forest with many other species mixed in

variants.name: Santa Cruz highlights
variants.description: A fairly long and strenuous circuit taking in the best bits around Santa Cruz including a great viewpoint, a canal path through semi rural areas, the church at Las Nieves, a dry riverbed descent, and watermills.

routes.name: Barranco de Mediera
routes.shortDescription: Daring walk through tunnels along precipitous cliff edge.
routes.description: An adventurous barranco walk. The route climbs up the steep-sided barranco before turning round and returning on a spectacular and highly vertiginous route high up the rock face passing through tunnels and along a narrow gallery path with a sheer drop to the side before gradually becoming a more normal forest descent along switchbacks.
routes.refreshments: Bar/Restaurant at Las Nieves.

images.caption: Gallery tunnel
The gallery path has partial protection from the steep drops
View into the valley from up high
View over Santa Cruz on the descent

routes.name: Puntallana to Los Sauces
routes.shortDescription: East coast walk that dips down to the sea.
routes.description: A long coastal walk along the only stretch of the GR 130 that actually goes close to the sea. Includes some lengthy stretches through dull banana plantations and a steep climb up to Los Sauces. Option to extend to the sea pools of Charco Azul.
routes.refreshments: Bars, café, restaurant in Puntallana. Bar & restaurant in San Andrés. Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces.

images.caption: Cliff view along the GR130
Jacaranda tree at the Fuente de San Juan
The only place where the GR130 actually meets the sea

routes.name: Cubo de la Galga
routes.shortDescription: Popular walk through laurisilva forest with a self-guided nature trail for kids.
routes.description: An easily accessed circuit through laurisilva jungle of high quality. The first part along easier tracks is a self-guided walk for which a free guide is available at the start and is suitable for children.
routes.refreshments: None en route. Restaurant on PR LP 5 intersection with LP-1 road (walk 6b).

images.caption: Small viaduct in the laurisilva forest.
Deep in the laurisilva forest
Mirador Somada Alta
Caves along the PR LP 5 variant route

variants.name: Self-guided tour
variants.description: The first road and track part of the walk can be done as an easy self-guided tour (free leafl et from the information offi ce) suitable for children. The leafl et text is linked to numbered points along the trail.

variants.name: Cubo La Galga with coastal loop
variants.description: For a full day's walk that maybe incorporates a restaurant break on the way you can split from the main walk and follow the PR LP 5 all the way down to the coast along the terrific Barranco hondo de Nogales then loop back up to rejoin the original walk following PR LP 5.1.

routes.name: Los Tilos Bridge
routes.shortDescription: Short exploration of the Los Tilos gorge and bridge.
routes.description: A nice little circuit on a protected pedestrian walkway that lets you fully appreciate the bridge and the gorge it spans.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces.

images.caption: Los Tilos Bridge
Nuestra Senora de Montserrat (church), Los Sauces

variants.name: Under the bridge fi gure of eight route
variants.description: To see the bridge form all angles and both sides take the concrete path that leads down into the gorge and under the bridge (clearly visible from on top). Climb steeply out to the end of the bridge.

routes.name: La Laguna
routes.shortDescription: Laurisilva forest walk with well-regarded restaurant stop by the disappointing lagoon.
routes.description: A steep climb leads into the protected laurisilva forest before descending to the rather dull lagoon. From there the way descends back to the road and traverses a couple of barrancos before circling back to the town.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Los Sauces. Bar/restaurant at Laguna de Barlovento.

images.caption: Sunny glade in the laurisilva forest.
Mirador de las Barandas
Looking up the Los Tilos valley

routes.name: Marcos y Cordero Springs
routes.shortDescription: Exciting downhill through tunnels to impressive springs.
routes.description: A classic walk through numerous (wet) tunnels and a high gallery path to the impressive springs. The descent begins steeply with a semi-scramble down a boulder-filled river bed before becoming a more normal path down the gorge changing from pine forest to laurisilva jungle ending up near the Los Tilos visitor centre. 4WD shared taxi or tour is required to reach the start.
routes.accessOther: Natour run tours with multiple pickup points.
routes.refreshments: Bar, café, restaurant Los Tilos Visitor Centre.

images.caption: Marcos y Cordero Springs
Narrow gallery path approaching the tunnels
Springs after the tunnels
Cascada De Los Tilos (walk 9c)
Some big boulders to negotiate on the descent

variants.name: To Mirador Espigon Altravesado
variants.description: A good short walk is to do just the last part of the route in reverse as far as the mirador (perhaps also a little further on as far as the fi rst bridge). It's a very worthwhile laurisilva forest walk with a good viewpoint as reward.

variants.name: To the Springs
variants.description: Fit walkers can do the walk in reverse up to the springs and then come back the same way saving the taxi fare. It's really a very long climb up though. The full walk to Casa del Monte and down again will be too much for all but the fi ttest.

variants.name: To a waterfall (if it's turned on!)
variants.description: There's a man-made waterfall near the visitor centre that's beautifully framed and worth visiting. It's only turned on though when there's enough water.

notes: Loss of GPS signal in tunnels is of no account - there's only one path.
Tunnels will be wet and slippery.
Some risk along high gallery path.

routes.name: Barlovento to Franceses
routes.shortDescription: Beautiful coastal walk with some large barrancos.
routes.description: Long acknowledged as one of the most attractive sections of path on the island, this classic walk is a succession of wonderful far-reaching views along the coast punctuated by explorations into the barrancos and wanderings through the scattered villages and small farms on the way. It's a fairly short and easy walk as far as Gallegos but the final barranco to Franceses is something else again and will consume about a third of your time.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés, restaurants in Barlovento. Bar/shop and bar in Gallegos.

images.caption: La Tosca has a small dragon tree grove
The approach to Gallegos
Branch route leading to the sea

variants.name: Barlovento to Gallegos
variants.description: The bus stops at Gallegos so you can halt the walk there if you don't fancy going all the way.

variants.name: To Gallegos and back
variants.description: The walk to Gallegos is short enough for a there-and back walk which would be justified given the attractiveness of the path.

routes.name: Barranco de las Angustias
routes.shortDescription: Spectacular hike through the Caldera interior returning along the river bed.
routes.description: A classic hike through the largest barranco on the island. A shared taxi is needed to get to start viewpoint then it’s an easy forest walk down to the river and ‘beach’. The return route is rather more strenuous but still mostly downhill following the river bed or the higher-level path that continually crosses it.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: Looking north-east from Playa de Taburiente
View from Mirador Los Brecitos
Descending to the riverbed
Path soon after the campsite
Cascada de Colores
Near Dos Agua

variants.name: To Cascada de Colores and back
variants.description: The walk up to the Cascada de Colores and back is a worthwhile alternative to the main walk. For variety you can follow the river all the way up and take the path on the way down when it offers an alternative.

variants.name: Playa de Taburiente to Mirador Cascada de La Fondada
variants.description: Add-on walk to a waterfall for the very fit or those camping.
variants.routeFile: LP26b Playa de Taburiente to Mirador Cascada de La Fondada.gpx

notes: The park will be closed in bad weather or if bad weather is expected.

routes.name: La Cumbrecita
routes.shortDescription: Forest climb to the saddle point between the Calsera and Pico Bejenado.
routes.description: A lengthy though undemanding forest climb to the Cumbrecita viewpoints with a couple of good miradors on the way. After a circuit of the Cumbrecita viewpoints the way descends rather more easily on the road with opportunities to get off the road on to forest paths.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: Vista Cumbre Vieja
Path connecting the Cumbrecita to Pico Bejenado

variants.name: Just the La Cumbrecita viewpoints by car
variants.description: good option if you're having a day off 'proper' walking but still want to stretch your legs. You need to book your parking slot in advance or arrive out of hours.

variants.name: Taxi up then walk down
variants.description: Taking a taxi to the top, completing a summit circuit, and then walking down the forest route is a popular choice.

variants.name: Side trip to Pico Bejenado
variants.description: If you are driving up to La Cumbrecita then you can make a proper walk of it by tacking on a side trip to Pico Bejenado. Allow enough time with some to spare when booking your parking permit.
variants.routeFile: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre.gpx

variants.name: To Pico Bejenado & return to the visitor centre
variants.description: Taxi to the start, Cumbracita circuit, Pico Bejenado, and long walk down to the visitor centre.
variants.routeFile: LP27d To Pico Bejenado and return to the visitor centre.gpx

routes.name: Pico Bejenado circuit
routes.shortDescription: Climb to the island's only true peak with far reaching views into the Caldera.
routes.description: A very picturesque circuit of the big volcano linking to La Cumbrecita. The views from on top are worth the sometimes steep climb but the whole circuit is a pleasant walk.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: view from Pico Bejenado looking towards Puerto Tazacorte
Caldera de Taburiente
Climbing to Pico Bejenado
Descending from Roque de Los Cuervos

variants.name: Taxi up then descend to the visitor centre
variants.description: Taking a taxi to the start from the visitor centre lets you extend the walk by walking back down on PR LP 13.3
variants.routeFile: LP28a Pista de Valencia to Centro de Visitantes.gpx

variants.name: Taxi up then descend to El Paso
variants.description: Forest descent opening out to abandoned terraces and meadows near El Paso.
variants.routeFile: LP28b Pista de Valencia to El Paso.gpx

notes: Variant descents are on unmarked paths.

routes.name: Llano de Jable
routes.shortDescription: An attractive open volcanic plane, a lava field and country lanes on this varied walk.
routes.description: A fairly lengthy forest climb to a lovely open area of volcanic sand and good views followed by an interesting descent through a lava field and an unsigned wander through country lanes.
routes.refreshments: None

images.caption: In the plains south of El Paso
Llanos de Jable
Crossing a lava field on PR LP 14
Bikers at the foot of Montaña Quemada (Volcán Tacande)

notes: The country lanes are unmarked and would be hard to navigate without GPS.

routes.name: Trans Cumbre
routes.shortDescription: Historic route over the Cumbre with views of both sides from the top.
routes.description: A transverse crossing of the Cumbre Nueva passing from country lanes to pine forest, clouds (probably), then dark and mossy cobbles and paths to a more open wooded final stretch.
routes.refreshments: Bars, restaurants, cafés, shops in Breña Alta

images.caption: Where PR LP1 and the GR131 meet on the Cumbre Nueva
Small shrine in the forest on PR LP 1
Ermita de la Virgen del Pino

notes: Cobbled sections are rather treacherous when wet.
The climb up to the Cumbra Nueva is a long staircase, hard on the knees.

routes.name: Cumbre Nueva loop
routes.shortDescription: Long circuit that rewards with some fine views on a clear day.
routes.description: A big circuit climbing up to Refugio El Pilar, traversing the Cumbre Nueva, then descending steeply down back to the start.
routes.refreshments: Possible snack from kiosk at Refugio El Pilar

images.caption: Fayal-brezal (myrtl-heather) on the Cumbre Nueva
Radio mast along the GR131
View of the Caldera from the Cumbre Nueva
Country lane around Tacande

variants.name: El Pilar to Reventon Pass
variants.description: With a car you can walk the Cumbre Nueva on its own following the forestry path in one direction and the GR 131 in the other.

notes: The climb up to the Cumbra Nueva is a long staircase, hard on the knees.

routes.name: Lavas de San Juan
routes.shortDescription: Traverse of the most dramatic lava field on the island.
routes.description: An exploration of one of the most dramatic lava fields on the island with a scarily big (but well protected) hole to peer down into as well.
routes.refreshments: Bars/cafés in San Nicholas.

images.caption: Lavas de San Juan
Looking to the Cumbre Vieja from PR LP 14.1
Poppy lined PR LP 14.1 path

notes: The first part of the walk is prone to erosion

dangers.name: Trip hazard
dangers.description: The lava field can cause nasty injuries if you trip.

routes.name: Montaña Marcos
routes.shortDescription: Peak with views and beautiful pine forest.
routes.description: A climb up to an interesting peak with good views and a nice easy section through the forest. If you’re lucky you may see paragliders taking off from a platform part way up.
routes.refreshments: Bar/café, pizza parlour, and a small shop in Jedy

images.caption: Unsigned but cairned path across the forest slope
View from Montaña Marcos
Montaña Marcos from near Jedy

variants.name: Link with walk 32 to make a big loop
variants.description: To combine the walks without doing them individually you can use a short linking section of track that cuts out the less interesting descent from Montaña Marcos and joins the San Nicholas walk somewhere near hoyo Grande. To complete the circuit a short easy section of the GR 130 is followed linking San Nicholas to Jedy.
variants.routeDirections: [33](01 to 14), short linking track to [32](04 to end) then GR 130 back to Jedy

notes: Scree slope to negotiate, more had work than falling risk
Careful on the peak in high winds or poor visibility
Much of the route is off marked trails so GPS will be need. Signal strength is generally good though.

routes.name: The Volcano Route
routes.shortDescription: Long but rewarding descent down the Cumbre Vieja.
routes.description: The classic hike along the volcanic spine of the island with multiple peak-bagging opportunities on the way. Great views all along and varied scenery ending in a descent through pine forest.
routes.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at the start. Bars, cafés, restaurants and shops in Los Canarios.

images.caption: View of the Caldera over the Aridane plain
Skirting Pico Birigoyo
The Malforda lava field and Volcán El Duraznero
Hoyo Negro
View of Tenerife from near Volcán de Martín

variants.name: To Pico Nambroque and back
variants.description: After Pico Nambroque it's probably not much more effort to complete the whole walk rather than return to refugio El Pilar. If you are just looking to avoid an expensive taxi ride back then you can go as far as deseada before returning

variants.name: Continue down to the sea
variants.description: Fit walkers can complete the route 'properly' by finishing at the lighthouses.
variants.routeFile: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses.gpx

notes: Vertigo is only likely to be an issue if you climb the peaks
Avoid the route in strong winds or poor visibility

routes.name: Pico Birigoyo circuit
routes.shortDescription: The 'real' volcano route that goes over the peaks.
routes.description: This walk takes the high line along the volcanic peaks. It’s an alternative to the first part of the Volcano Route which follows a lower line not climbing the peaks. Spectacular views but very windy. Finishes by looping back through pleasant easy tracks.
routes.refreshments: Mobile kiosk at Refugio El Pilar serves drinks and snacks.

images.caption: Approaching the peak of Volcan Birigoyo
Montaña la Barquita
Towards Montaña la Barquita
Near Pico Nambroque

notes: Pico Birigoyo ascent is very exposed and vertigo inducing
Some loose material when descending steep paths off the volcanos.
Strong winds are a major hazard climbing Pico Birigoyo

routes.name: Volcán de Martín
routes.shortDescription: Colourful volcanic landscapes and wide ranging views.
routes.description: Starting from Área Recreativa Fuente Los Roques the walk goes through some lovely volcanic landscapes before climbing the volcano and descending by way of a lava field. Great views all along. The start requires a car to get to but you can also walk the last bit of the Volcano Route in reverse to reach the trail.
routes.refreshments: Bars, cafés and restaurants in Los Canarios

images.caption: Ascending Volcán de Martín
View from Volcán de Martín
Picon (black pea-gravel) path at the base of Volcán de Martín
Natural Bugloss rockery on SL FU 110

variants.name: Walk up from Los Canarios
variants.description: Access for non-drivers by walking up from Los Canarios.

notes: The ascent up Volcán de Martín is exposed.
Avoid climbing Volcán de Martín in high winds or poor visibility.

routes.name: Volcan San Antonio
routes.shortDescription: A simple walk around Volcán San Antonio.
routes.description: An easy circuit of the volcano if you want something more than just the summit climb. Takes in some faint petroglyphs on the way.
routes.refreshments: Café in the visitor centre and a restaurant near the access road.

images.caption: Centro de Visitantes del San Antonio
Volcán de San Antonio
Path round crest of Volcán de San Antonio

variants.name: Walk 38 with Volcán Teneguía summit
variants.description: Add-on to climb the peak
variants.routeFile: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses.gpx
variants.routeDirections: At [37](06) side trip [38](09 to 12 and back)

notes: Although protected, Volcán San Antonio is a moderate vertigo risk.
Volcán San Antonio rim should be avoided in strong winds or poor visibility

routes.name: Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses
routes.shortDescription: Volcanic descent with peak-bagging opportunity.
routes.description: After circling Volcán San Antonio and climbing Volcán Teneguia (optional) the path descends through a volcanic wasteland to the lighthouses, salt pans and sea at the southern tip of the island.
routes.routeFile: LP38 Volcan Teneguia to the lighthouses.gpx
routes.refreshments: Bars/cafés/restaurants and shops in Los Canarios. Café in the visitor centre, restaurant near the access road. Restaurant by the salt pans in Faro de Fuencaliente.

images.caption: New Faro de Fuencaliente with the old lighthouse (now a museum) behind
Climbing Volcán de Teneguía
Final crater rim walk to summit of Volcán de Teneguía
Descending from Volcán de Teneguía to the lighthouses
Salt pans next to the lighthouse

notes: Marked paths except for a shortcut and the obvious route up Teneguia
Volcán Teneguía is a moderate vertigo risk and unsafe in high winds.
Some scrambling needed when ascending Volcán Teneguía
Volcán Teneguía should be avoided in strong winds or poor visibility
